title: Termination of Emergency With Respect to the Situation in Zimbabwe

enrichment.summary: This executive order officially ends the national emergency declared in 2003 related to Zimbabweâ€™s government and its undermining of democratic processes. While the U.S. remains concerned about violence, human rights abuses, and corruption in Zimbabwe, the emergency status and associated sanctions are terminated, along with prior related executive orders.
potential_concerns: Terminating the emergency and revoking sanctions may reduce U.S. leverage to address ongoing human rights abuses and corruption in Zimbabwe.
Affected Zimbabwean individuals or entities formerly under sanctions may seek to resume activities that could undermine democratic reforms.
The order might be perceived internationally as a sign of reduced U.S. commitment to supporting democracy and human rights in Zimbabwe.
Residual legal or financial actions tied to prior sanctions could face enforcement or interpretation challenges post-termination.
